adjective.description: Relating to or used for formal events of a religious or public nature.
examples: the solemn, ceremonial air of a procession of monks

adjective.description: (of a position or role) involving only nominal authority or power.
examples: originally a ceremonial post, it is now a position with executive power

noun.description: The system of rules and procedures to be observed at a formal or religious occasion.
examples: the procedure was conducted with all due ceremonial

origin: Late Middle English: from late Latin caerimonialis, from Latin caerimonia religious worship (see ceremony).
